summary.p: Regarding Columan [Ryß], administrator [of the Carthusian monastery Ittingen], Mayor Röist is mistaken; Werdmüller has indeed sent him documents from his predecessor Jodok [Hesch], another bad person. Could not respond more quickly due to his gout illness.

div.p: Grace and peace from the Lord God through Christ, etc.

My master Heinrich, regarding Columan, know that my lord Röist is mistaken. Indeed, before him there was another fellow, also an administrator, named Jodok, who is now a prior in Franconia. I have brought letters from him, which my lord Röist speaks of, although I now know Columan well as a slanderer and a vessel of all shamelessness, as his words and deeds testify, etc.
Do not hold the delay against me; for the severe gout, which I will attempt to alleviate with spa treatments, has been so troublesome until now that my hands could not hold a pen.
My most learned Heinrich, the Lord be with you.
To the learned and pious master Heinrich Bullinger, pastor in Zurich, my gracious lord and brother.
